website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy and good-sized trailer that holds up well over time.
pros: Trailer has a lot of room
Quick-release hitch makes it easy to attach and detach
Tires are durable and come with reflectors for increased visibility
cons: Tires can lose air easily, so be sure to keep an eye on them (or better yet, carry a pump)
Assembly instructions can be a bit confusing
Some arrive with slight defects or scratches

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS PICTURED
customer_reviews.text: Received the product in poor packaging. Some of the tubing on the cart were ovaled out and not round as intended. The picture shows the front and back of the cart to have a swinging door for easy access. The one received is fixed unless I unscrew the bolts holding it together. The tires had the same issue, a pin hold them in place not the same as the picture. Will be updating this with pictures for all to see.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Adds versatility to your bike
customer_reviews.text: Very cool! This cart has stood up great for 2 seasons. We bought this to haul our kiteboarding gear to a couple of nearby water accesses, but also use it to cart stuff to the beach. You can really load it up with a couple of bungee cords. The wheels occasionally need to be pumped up, but that's about it!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: It quickly and easily attached to either one of our bicycles and its ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to use on a long sailing trip for when we would make port and restock supplies. It quickly and easily attached to either one of our bicycles and its perfect for doing a quick grocery trip on bicycles. The cart never went sideways or came unhooked. Being collapsible was a must since we were scarce on empty space. We could not have switched out the propane bottle at local gas stations without this cart.
customer_reviews.author: StewBeck

customer_reviews.title: This thing destroyed my bike
customer_reviews.text: After about a year of occasional use this thing has in fact destroyed my bike (large mens mountain bike) because of the way the hitch is designed to be installed at the back. You have to attach it at the rear axle, so the extra torque this placed on the bike frame caused one of the welds to break where the rear frame narrows down to hold the rear axle.
customer_reviews.author: CDW

customer_reviews.title: Good cart
customer_reviews.text: Have been using the cart all Summer to cart things to the beach or to take our dog with us on long bike rides. It has worked very well. Came mostly assembled, strong steel frame and durable hard plastic platform. Well designed with doors on both sides which allows you to carry items that may be longer than the cart. The only negative was that it was packed poorly for shipping. When it arrived the box was torn in several places as the cart pieces had punched through since there is no packing materials around it. This caused some scratches. It is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hardy

customer_reviews.title: What an excitement
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 2 months ago and so far nothing has happened to it. The weight limit says 75 pounds but iv made it carry 170 pounds. Its very light weight, and will fold up in seconds for easy storage, a durable rubber tires and tubes are on the rims and it will travel over just about anything. It will fit onto any bike with a little attachment on the back tire. Its lasting a long time and I hope it stays that way.
customer_reviews.author: Иiск Р

customer_reviews.title: Solid, easy to assemble and use.
customer_reviews.text: It’s really solid and easy to assemble but a bit on the small side for lugging multiple beach chairs and umbrellas. With that said, with a few bungee cords, I made it work for my purposes. No buyer’s remorse, just wish it was just a bit bigger. Otherwise, great product!
customer_reviews.author: Linda H

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price. I use this trailer to go clamming, I bike on a somewhat bumpy gravel road and have no problems even when loaded down with about 40 lbs of shellfish. It folds down very easily and easily fits in my SUV and would fit in most car trunks.
customer_reviews.author: VCAPA

customer_reviews.title: Great beach cart
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and great beach cart for the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy. A little tricky to connect to bicycles
customer_reviews.text: Been very sturdy for carrying vegetables from a large garden to the kitchen on a farm. The connection to the bicycle has been a little tricky and you may need to experiment with different bolts and lock washers. We've also gone through lots of bungee cords.
customer_reviews.author: MakerMark

customer_reviews.title: bike trailer
customer_reviews.text: It will get the job done. just put 150bls in it.
customer_reviews.author: John T Viles

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: We use this every time we go to the beech,it fits the cooler,chairs and towels! Now we can ride our bikes to the beech and get exercise and not pay the entry fee to the beech as we could through for free.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen R. Letourneau

customer_reviews.title: Dependable if your needs are limited
customer_reviews.text: Nice, solid little trailer, nice and light. With a load ( and mine can be up to 40 pounds) it jerks a little to one side when you're riding, especially going up hills, but that's okay - it's not really a problem. I only use it on Saturdays and Sundays for grocery runs and stuff. Only really odd thing it is ships with no assembly instructions - fortunately the assembly is pretty basic and I was able to figure it out, but I can see how it could be a problem for some. Great for weekends only, strictly local use. All in all, nice - if your needs are limited.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick S. Benton

customer_reviews.title: wonderful cart and the price is right
customer_reviews.text: wonderful cart and the price is right. i got a wire basket for it from marshall's, and take my dog everywhere in it. bueno!
customer_reviews.author: Flip

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I bought this. The money was good too.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed. Solid construction and the wheels are very good
customer_reviews.text: Bought this based upon the positive reviews before me. You won't be disappointed. Solid construction and the wheels are very good. Glad I did it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Smaller than I thought but holds up to 100 pounds per instructions so hopefully stacking items will be OK.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: well made, our son doesn't drive so he uses this with his bike. works great. Took a few minutes to figure out how it connects to the bike but he loves it
customer_reviews.author: LeahMac

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Little heavy, but, rugged and solid. Versatility in that sides can be removed to accomodate various cargo loads and configurations. I already had a large, grey Rubbermaid tote with red handles, sold at the large home improvement stores, that dropped in for a perfect, tight fit. Love the trailer...goes nearly everywhere with me.
customer_reviews.author: Atoidi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This bicylce trailer is just what I needed. It is not really wide so it still safe riding on the roadways. I can take off the tires and fold it down and place in the trunk. Put our bicycles on our vehicle bicycle rack and head on out. Load it with our beach chairs, cooler, mats, hibachi and ukulele and go discovering for a good picnic spot away from the parking lot. {{{{Perfect}}}}
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Arrived scratched!
customer_reviews.text: My cart arrived in a timely manner and it looks like it's exactly what we need. One big problem is that our cart arrived with scratches all over the outer bars. It looks like we were sold a used cart. I would have given it a 5 star if it was not scratched up.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: M-Wave bicycle trailer
customer_reviews.text: I love the M-Wave folding bicycle trailer. It's great for going to the store and running errands where you can't put everything in your bike baskets. I don't even own a car.
customer_reviews.author: J T Roth

customer_reviews.title: Durable Trailer
customer_reviews.text: I live on an island and use the bike trailer to haul my dive equipement. I've had it for few months now and its never let me down. It follows the bike with little resitance and even at high speeds loaded or unloaded it will trail the bike well. Its folding makes it excellent if you wish to bring it inside for storage when no in use. I highly recommend this trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. B

customer_reviews.title: wheels are trash
customer_reviews.text: after one week of receiving this trailer the wheels rims were rusting. one wheel would not stay inflated because of defective spacing for the spoke tape. not a good value at all.
customer_reviews.author: nancy feely

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Works well behind my electric bike.
customer_reviews.text: The axle is 5/8" so the connector was too small - less than 1/2". Had to drill the connector to fit. The wheels have a quick- release feature so to be safe when parked they probably should be locked up. Would preferred they be permanently attached. Sturdy construction. Meets expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Charles E. Skillin

customer_reviews.title: "Woody" dog wagon
customer_reviews.text: I converted mine into a "woody" trailer. There are pet trailers out there, but this one can be so versatile. I added the sides to keep tails and paws out of the wheel spokes, a door mat to keep the paws from sliding on the hard plastic bottom, and a tie-down/tether that secures through the flooring. There are larger trailers out there, but then you become limited as to where the bike can go.
customer_reviews.author: Regina G. James

customer_reviews.title: like many here the only weak point are the wheels ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought mine about 4 years ago and still going strong, like many here the only weak point are the wheels and tires that's why i gave it 4 stars, would be five but for that. That being said I still haven't replaced them but I will soon. I put a lot of miles on this, its my grocery shopping vehicle, I have an electric bike so I definitely run this at higher speeds and so far so good. Don't go with the cheapies.
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Very well made trailer
customer_reviews.text: I have a project that I needed done I don't have a car or a licence so the cart helped me out a lot going 2.6 miles back and forth to Home depo on sundays 3 to 4 times in the day picking up 12" by 12" bricks and other materials that was needed.The road i took was on the bike trail in new haven, CT so if you ride it you know there is not a lot of things that can puncher the tires on the cart so it worked well for me.
customer_reviews.author: windy thomas

product_meta.title: M-Wave Foldable Luggage Trailer
product_meta.description: The M-Wave Foldable Luggage Trailer is a great option for carrying your cargo on your daily commute or long tour. Foldable sides, attachment arm and removable tires make storing trailer a breeze. Quick release hitch lets you remove trailer from bike easily.
feature_bullets: [FRAME] foldable for storage and made of steel
[DIMENSIONS] total length is 27 inches x 19 inches wide and interior loading surface dimensions of 23 inches x 17 inches, with sides to help keep cargo secure
[CAPACITY] Maximum load of 88 lbs or (40 KG)
[FEATURES] Quick-release wheels and quick release hitch to move quickly between bikes
[WHEELS] Tires sized 16 x 1.75" with included reflectors for visibility
